# NSBluetoothPeripheralUsageDescription

**Property List Key**

A message that tells people why the app is requesting the ability to connect to Bluetooth peripherals.

## Discussion

For apps with a deployment target of iOS 13 and later, use [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription] instead.

For deployment targets earlier than iOS 13, add both [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription] and [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSBluetoothPeripheralUsageDescription] to your app’s [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List] file. Devices running earlier versions of iOS rely on [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSBluetoothPeripheralUsageDescription], while devices running later versions rely on [doc://com.apple.bundleresources/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription].



## Bluetooth

- **NSBluetoothAlwaysUsageDescription**: A message that tells people why the app needs access to Bluetooth.
